summary: Arthur G. Vaivada was a CIA agent who requested reassignment from Cuba in June 1958. He is also known as Ross L. Crozier, and documents related to him are associated with Project HUMANOID in Costa Rica. The documents cover a range of topics including his contract extensions, operational clearance requests, promotion considerations, and suitability for contact agent work. His activities span from at least January 1952 to 1958, with later documentation in 1975 referencing his earlier work. The documents suggest Vaivada/Crozier was involved in various operational activities and personnel matters within the CIA, including work in Cuba and Costa Rica.
significance: The significance of Arthur G. Vaivada (Ross L. Crozier) in the JFK assassination context is not explicitly stated in the provided documents. However, his involvement in CIA operations in Cuba and Costa Rica during the period leading up to the assassination, as well as his association with Project HUMANOID, could be of interest to researchers investigating potential connections between CIA activities and the assassination. Further investigation would be needed to determine any direct relevance to the JFK assassination.
